summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors and FBI agents discussing strategy in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It reveals that a victim's attorney shared a grand jury subpoena with Epstein's lawyers, who complained to Washington, leading prosecutors to alter their indictment plans and postpone interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal investigation; his lawyers received a copy of a grand jury subpoena and complained to Washington about the prosecutor.

events.title: Planned indictment presentation
events.description: Prosecutors plan to present an indictment on Tuesday morning, after removing the New York section, with plans to later supersede it.

events.title: Subpoena disclosure to Epstein's lawyers
events.description: A victim's attorney gave a copy of a grand jury subpoena to Epstein's lawyers, who then complained to Washington about the lead prosecutor.

keyFacts: A victim's attorney disclosed a grand jury subpoena to Jeffrey Epstein's legal team, who used it to complain to Washington about the lead prosecutor.
This disclosure caused prosecutors to cancel planned interviews in New York and alter their indictment strategy, removing the New York section.
Prosecutors planned to present the revised indictment on Tuesday morning (June 24, 2008) and then supersede it later.
A new victim from Florida was identified to replace a 'New York Jane Doe' in the indictment.
